description:
The second season of NieR:Automata Ver1.1a.

The year 11954. YoRHa Soldiers 2B and 9S are newly dispatched to Earth to carry out and support the 243rd Descent Operation. There, they succeed in destroying the machine lifeform core units, Adam and Eve. With the annihilation of these enemies, the Army of Humanity takes this chance to end this long-lasting war and decides on an all-out attack against the machine lifeforms. This is a record of the battles and hopes of Androids and the fate which dictates them all…

As war rages on, Unit 2B and others like her question their role. Reclaiming the planet will take sacrifice, but how much more can they give and is humanity worth the cost?

(Source: Crunchyroll, Crunchyroll Twitter)

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a world or civilization after a global disaster.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Puppetry
tags.description: Animation style involving the manipulation of puppets to act out scenes.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Desert
tags.description: Prominently features a desert environment.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Gods
tags.description: Prominently features a character of divine or religious nature.

title.native: ヨルハ 真珠湾降下作戦記録

node.description:
A Japanese video game director and scenario writer, having worked most notably at now-defunct game company Cavia. He became known for his work on the action role-playing video game series *Drakengard* and its spin-off *Nier*.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yokotaro) | [Blog](http://yokotaro.blogspot.jp/) | [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/yokotaro/)

[Website](http://www.lxixsxa.com/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/lxixsxa/) | [Profile (Anison)](http://anison.info/data/person/29206.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/LiSA_OLiVE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/xlisa_olivex/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/lisaSMEJ) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/lxixsxa.jp) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA_(Japanese_musician,_born_1987)) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/LiSA)

LiSA is a Japanese singer, songwriter and lyricist from Seki, Gifu. LiSA started her own band while in high school to catch a growing wave of punk rock. In 2008, she moved to Tokyo in order to further her musical career. The name "LiSA" stands for "Love is Same All" or "LiVE is Smile Always."

She announced her marriage to voice actor and singer [Tatsuhisa Suzuki](https://anilist.co/staff/95735/Tatsuhisa-Suzuki) on January 22, 2020.

[Official Website](https://www.hrg116.com) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_m.hrg_/) | [Nico Nico Douga](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/14605359/mylist?ref=pc_userpage_menu)

Mie Hiraga is an animation producer. She currently works on video production with motion graphics elements.

He is an art director and supervisor, who was a long time member of Bihou until 2007 when he went to head the background art department in Totonyan. He belongs to the anime production group Neko-Nanban-Tei together with director Watanabe Takashi and his wife Miyata Naomi.

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)

A Japanese video game director and scenario writer, having worked most notably at now-defunct game company Cavia. He became known for his work on the action role-playing video game series *Drakengard* and its spin-off *Nier*.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yokotaro) | [Blog](http://yokotaro.blogspot.jp/) | [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/yokotaro/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tk_mogi)

Color designer who works frequently with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).
